For x\geq 0 and p>1 let x=\lambda p and define A_{0}(\lambda)=1 , A_{k+1}(\lambda)=(1-2k\lambda)A_{k}(\lambda)+\lambda(\lambda+1)\frac{\mathrm{d }A_{k}(\lambda)}{\mathrm{d}\lambda}, if k=0,1,2,\dots, so that A_{k}(\lambda) is a polynomial in \lambda of degree k-1 when k\geq 1.
Then as p\to\infty E_{p}\left(\lambda p\right)\sim\frac{e^{-\lambda p}}{(\lambda+1)p}\sum_{k=0}^{ \infty}\frac{A_{k}(\lambda)}{(\lambda+1)^{2k}}\frac{1}{p^{k}}, uniformly for \lambda\in[0,\infty).
